author: Rick Spilman
content: Thanks, Doug and Boca Jim. I’ve updated the post to mention the bridge and other buuildings, ships and parks nemd for Harriet.

author: Boca Jim
content:
According to the National Park Service website this date (02/07/2026):

“The Harriet Tubman Memorial Bridge spans the Combahee River between Beaufort and Colleton Counties in South Carolina. It is the site of a raid conducted by Harriet Tubman and African American soldiers of the 2nd South Carolina Infantry in June 1863.”

author: Doug faunt
content: The bridge on US17 across the river is named the Harriet Tubman Bridge. Unless it’s been renamed under the current administration.

author: Aaron D
content: Excellent post. Thank you for sharing this important story.
